page.title: 01LOCAL AREA PLEAN AND COWIE
page.content: There are four primary schools in the area including one Catholic school, plus one special school. None of them have more than 200 pupils. The four mainstream schools were all built in the last century. West Plean School began as a fee paying school for colliers' children. There used to be several collieries in the area but now there is only one. Plean Colliery closed in 1962. The school is situated on the old Roman Road and is surrounded by many interesting places that we frequently visit with our teacher. There is a fort just north of Plean House and a Broch at Torwood. The Field of Bannockburn is visited by thousands of tourists.
